intro: Corydalis magni, commonly known as the giant corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
